name: 楊元森
objective: This course teaches the basic computer programming skill using and its application to engineering problems. FORTRAN and MATLAB  are selected in this course. FORTRAN is one of the classical programming languages that have been used in scientific computation societies. This course especially focuses on friendly guidance for basic learners without programming background.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to FORTRAN/MATLAB
Week 2: FORTRAN/MATLAB Basic 
Week 3: Variables and basic operations
Week 4: Variables and basic operations
Week 5: Branching Statements
Week 6: Loop
Week 7: Array / Vector / Matrix
Week 8: Midterm simulation
Week 9: Midterm
Week 10: Loop, advanced
Week 11: Loop, advanced
Week 12: User defined functions 
Week 13: Sub-programs
Week 14: Arrays
Week 15: Handle Graphics
Week 16: Graphical User Interface Development
Week 17: Final exam. simulation
Week 18: Final exam.
materials:
S.J. Chapman,” MATLAB Programming with Applications for Engineers”, 1st Ed., Cengage Learning, Melbourne, Australia, 2012.
